intro: Sterculia castroi, commonly known as the African tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces woody pods that contain oily seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil.
